SPEAKER: Balduk
TEXT: Hi, this is some example dialogue. Isn't that neat! Anyways, you don't look like you're from around here. Where are you from?

SPEAKER: Aaron
TEXT: Oh, I'm from the capital! Irkenstead.

SPEAKER: Balduk
TEXT: Oh wow, the capital huh? Which district?

\/ Dialogue ID \/: The "VOICEOVER ID" column should be populated with values matching this formatting: X_Y. Where X is the full dialogue ID and Y is that line. So if it is diologue 83 and line 5, it would be entered as '83_5'. If the line has a silent voiceline, leave it blank, or write "none", "nothing" or "silence".
SPEAKER: Aaron
TEXT: I am enrolled at ~The College of Irkenstead~!

SPEAKER: Balduk
TEXT: Trade district huh, lots of hustle and bustle I guess.

SPEAKER: Balduk
TEXT: Oh nice, I have a cousin who lives there.

\/ Dialogue ID \/: Most NPCs will be on the right side. But if there is a long dialogue between two, where the player is uninvolved, it may be appropriate to have one on the left.
For responses, write the spreadshet line on which that response appears.

In columns O, P, and Q, please list all speakers in this dialogue. If you wish to enter a talking (or 'yapping') speed for the character sprite, you can input a number between 0 and 1, such as 0.4, with 1 being the fastest and 0 being no motion at all. The sprite can be left empty.
